subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Ryan Harrison, 15, beat Pablo Cuevas of Uruguay, 6-4, 6-3, in the United States Clay Court Championship in Houston to become the 10th player in the Open era to win a main-draw match before his 16th birthday. Harrison, a Texan, is the youngest player to get a main-draw win on the ATP Tour since Rafael Nadal, the current No. 2 in the world, won his first tour match in Mallorca, Spain, in 2002. Harrison is the third player this decade to do it before turning 16.
